newsitem.title: CANADA: Toronto stocks open firmer but seeking direction.
newsitem.headline: Toronto stocks open firmer but seeking direction.

* Toronto stocks edged up at Tuesday's open, rebounding from two straight sessions of losses on the back of higher conglomerates. * 17 million shares traded worth C$211 million.
Toronto's key stock index opened slightly higher in active trading on Tuesday, reacting to firmer North American bond markets today and Wall Street stocks yesterday.
"The bond market is a little better. (Stocks are) taking the cue from bonds," one trader said. Canada's 30-year benchmark bond rose C$0.29 to C$119.12 to yield 6.534 percent.
The key stock index also belatedly firmed after Wall Street rose nearly 31 points on Monday, he added.
"It will stay quiet here right through the summer," he predicted.
Investors were expected to be cautious ahead of U.S. July retail sales and U.S. July producer prices out tomorrow.

Toronto's 14 sub-indexes were evenly split between winners and losers. Gainers included conglomerates, transportation and industrial products while decliners were led by golds, retail and consumer products.
Advancing issues beat out falling ones 247 to 221 while 247 traded flat.
--- HOT STOCKS ---
* High technology firm Hummingbird Communications Ltd rose 2.90 to 52.90 in light trading.

* Beleaguered Repap Enterprises Inc rose 0.02 to 0.25 on more than 7.6 million shares. Silverton International Fund Ltd and Paloma Partners LLC, which own about 29 percent of Repap's common shares, said they would act together to force Repap to change its management and board of directors.
